film condensed: Mark Twain quote.
reality condensed: Refers to ignorance in housing market.

film condensed: Burry reads mortgage bonds like a novel.
reality condensed: Burry read the lot, realised things were bad.

reality condensed: Mortgage bonds were full of bad loans.

film condensed: Burry claims he's going to invent a way to short the market.
reality condensed: No instruments for betting against the housing market at that point.

reality condensed: Eisman chased down BS.

reality condensed: Greenblatt was furious.

film condensed: Baum sees Tao, asks if she's pregnant.
reality condensed: Tao is probably a fictional character.

film condensed: Vennett calls Baum's office by mistake.
reality condensed: We can't find a source on this.

reality condensed: Lippmann pitched swaps to Eisman.

film condensed: Baum is interested in Vennett's idea.
reality condensed: Lippmann had Eisman interested.

film condensed: Baum tells his team to research the housing market.
reality condensed: Eisman sent his team on a research mission.

film condensed: Geller & Shipley fail to get an ISDA.
reality condensed: They were way under the minimal capital.

film condensed: They find Vennett's prospectus.
reality condensed: A friend sent them Lippmann's prospectus.

film condensed: Shipley & Geller got rich from their garage.
reality condensed: They turned $110k into $30m from their garage.

film condensed: They call Rickert for help.
reality condensed: Hockett quit Wall Street, joined Cornwall Capital Management.

film condensed: Baum's team do some research in Florida.
reality condensed: They went to Florida to figure out the housing market.

film condensed: Fields wants his money back.
reality condensed: Greenblatt wanted to withdraw his investment.

film condensed: Baum gets a tour from an estate agent.
reality condensed: Eisman didn't take a tour with an estate agent.

film condensed: Baum talks to two mortgage brokers.
reality condensed: These mortgage brokers weren't in the book.

film condensed: Baum asks a stripper about her home loans.
reality condensed: Eisman didn't interrogate a stripper about her loans.

film condensed: Baum buys $50m in swaps from Vennett.
reality condensed: Eisman agreed to deal with Lippmann.

reality condensed: Daniel arranged to buy the swaps.

film condensed: Rickert agrees to help them short the market.
reality condensed: Hockett agreed to help.

film condensed: Rickert gets them an ISDA.
reality condensed: Hockett got Cornwall Capital an ISDA.

film condensed: Mortgages start to fail, CDOs go up.
reality condensed: CDOs went up while mortgages defaulted.

film condensed: Baum tells Deutsche to f*** off.
reality condensed: Eisman told the risk guys to f*** off.

film condensed: Baum meets with Hale.
reality condensed: She admitted the ratings agencies were corrupt.

film condensed: Burry's office is near empty, Scion's value down.
reality condensed: Scion's value went down, Burry fired staff.

film condensed: Shipley & Geller shocked, talk to Rickert.
reality condensed: They couldn't believe what they were seeing.

film condensed: Everyone panics.
reality condensed: Everyone was freaking out.

film condensed: They all go to the ASF in Vegas.
reality condensed: They attended the ASF to figure out the state of the market.

film condensed: Baum challenges Dantone at a the presentation.
reality condensed: Eisman challenged the speaker.

film condensed: Shipley & Geller go shooting with Bear Stearns.
reality condensed: Ledley went shooting with Bear Stearns.

reality condensed: Ratings agency staff wanted jobs at the banks.

film condensed: Geller questions a Merrill rep.
reality condensed: The Cornwall guys questioned loads of people.

film condensed: An analyst asks Burry if he could be wrong.
reality condensed: Investors thought Burry was wrong.

film condensed: Geller suggests buying up AA bonds.
reality condensed: They bought up AA bonds.

film condensed: They buy as many as they can.
reality condensed: They tried to buy as many AAs as they could.

film condensed: Rickert reminds the others how bad this is.
reality condensed: They were aware of the catastrophe on the horizon.

film condensed: Baum talks to a CDO manager, gets scared.
reality condensed: Eisman's talk with Chau got him really worried.

film condensed: Thaler/Gomez cameo - explain synthetic CDOs.
reality condensed: The book explains synthetic CDOs.

film condensed: Baum instructs his guys to short Chau's stuff.
reality condensed: Eisman shorted Chau big time.

film condensed: They all leave the conference looking miserable.
reality condensed: The conference scared them.

reality condensed: Eisman lost his son, not his brother.

film condensed: Burry restricts investors' withdrawals, they're not happy.
reality condensed: Burry restricted withdrawals, got threatened with lawsuits.

film condensed: Titles - Murakami end-of-the-world quote.
reality condensed: These guys were pretty scared.

reality condensed: The crash began in 2007.

reality condensed: The risk people wanted Eisman to sell.

film condensed: Burry argues with Goldman on the phone.
reality condensed: Burry insisted the banks were wrong.

film condensed: Geller calls his mother to warn her.
reality condensed: Ledley's mother told him to go on Lithium.

film condensed: Geller & Shipley realise the system is criminal.
reality condensed: Cornwall Capital realised the system was corrupt.

reality condensed: No friend at WSJ.

reality condensed: Everyone wanted credit swaps.

film condensed: Goldman call Burry, making nice.
reality condensed: Goldman got desperate.

film condensed: Goldman loses $15bn.
reality condensed: Goldman lost $15bn in the crisis.

film condensed: Daniel wants Baum to sell. He won't.
reality condensed: Eisman was on a moral crusade, he wasn't selling.

film condensed: Geller & Shipley need Rickert, he's in England.
reality condensed: Hockett was on holiday in England.

film condensed: Rickert sells their swaps from a pub.
reality condensed: Hockett sold their swaps from a pub in Exmouth.

film condensed: Burry emails Fields re his massive profit.
reality condensed: Burry's email said only, 'you're welcome'.

reality condensed: Lippmann was offered $50m bonus.

film condensed: Rickert sells the swaps to Europe.
reality condensed: 3/4 of the swaps went to UBS.

reality condensed: Eisman was invited to speak opposite Miller.

film condensed: As Baum speaks, Bear Stearns crashes.
reality condensed: Bear Stearns crashed as they spoke.

film condensed: Everyone scrambles to leave.
reality condensed: Everyone left in a panic, Stearns was crashing.

film condensed: Lehman Brothers collapses.
reality condensed: Lehman Brothers went bankrupt.

film condensed: Daniel begs Baum to sell.
reality condensed: Daniel was getting antsy.

film condensed: Burry closes Scion after making a huge profit.
reality condensed: Burry closed the fund.

film condensed: Geller & Shipley walk around the Lehman building.
reality condensed: They didn't enter the Lehman building.

film condensed: Baum is depressed by the corruption he's seen.
reality condensed: Eisman was saddened by the state of things.

film condensed: Narrator - the banks got away with it.
reality condensed: Only one guy went to jail.

film condensed: Baum agrees to sell, makes $1bn profit.
reality condensed: Eisman's fund made $1bn profit.

reality condensed: The collapse affected millions, cost trillions.

reality condensed: Eisman calmed down after the collapse.
